aphasia.title: Try a simulation
aphasia.directions: These exercises replicate the different forms of aphasia.
aphasia.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a clinical cognitive condition like brain damage.

borrow-glasses.title: Borrow a pair of glasses
borrow-glasses.directions: The prescription strength doesn’t matter. If you wear glasses already, take them off.
borrow-glasses.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like Nearsightedness or Farsightedness.

brightness.title: Adjust your screen's brightness
brightness.directions: Use either your monitor's settings, or do this through your operating system (Mac or Windows).
brightness.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like glare or contrast loss.

dyslexia.title: Install a bookmarklet
dyslexia.directions: Add this Dyslexia simulator bookmarklet to your web browser. Turn it on before using the web.
dyslexia.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a clinical cognitive condition like Dyslexia.

dominant-hand.title: Sit on your dominant hand
dominant-hand.directions: You'll have to rely on your non-dominant hand.
dominant-hand.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a motor condition like limb loss.

exercise-strenuously.title: Exercise strenuously
exercise-strenuously.directions: Try a total body workout, then try and prepare dinner from scratch. Remember to stretch and hydrate!
exercise-strenuously.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a motor condition like Multiple Sclerosis.

head-wand.title: Hold a pencil with your mouth
head-wand.directions: Then keep your hands behind your back and try to use your computer with the head wand.
head-wand.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a motor condition like quadriplegia.

high-contrast.title: Enable high contrast mode
high-contrast.directions: Use this operating system setting on Mac or Windows to enable a special theme.
high-contrast.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like cataracts.

loud-coffee-shop.title: Go to a loud coffee shop
loud-coffee-shop.directions: Try and have a quiet conversation with a friend. A bar could also suffice.
loud-coffee-shop.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have an auditory condition like hearing loss.

magnifier.title: Use a screen magnifier
magnifier.directions: Use this program on Mac or Windows to enable a special window that zooms in on what your mouse is hovering over.
magnifier.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like Glaucoma.

mute-speaker.title: Mute your speakers
mute-speaker.directions: Then try and watch a documentary on YouTube
mute-speaker.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have an auditory condition like deafness via neural hearing loss.

no-coffee.title: Use NoCoffee
no-coffee.directions: Add this low vision simulator extension to Google Chrome. Turn it on before using the web.
no-coffee.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like color blindness or a blocked visual field.

play-static.title: Listen to this video
play-static.directions: Put on some earbuds and play this video. Then try and have a conversation with a coworker.
play-static.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have an auditory condition like Tinnitus.

pig-latin.title: Speak in Pig Latin
pig-latin.directions: Familiarize yourself with the rules and then exclusively use it to communicate.
pig-latin.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a functional cognitive condition like an oral learning disability.

screen-reader.title: Close your eyes and use a screen reader
screen-reader.directions: Use either <abbr title='Job Access With Speech'>JAWS</abbr> on Windows or VoiceOver on Mac to operate your computer.
screen-reader.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like blindness.

translate.title: Run your documents through a translator
translate.directions: Google offers a service to help with this. The lack of accuracy is the point!
translate.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a functional cognitive condition like English as a second language.

unplug-mouse.title: Unplug your mouse
unplug-mouse.directions: Navigate your computer using the keyboard. Using the trackpad is cheating!
unplug-mouse.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a motor condition like foo.

wake-up-early.title: Wake up early
wake-up-early.directions: Set an alarm for 2:45 AM and immediately try to book a flight for that vacation you've been dreaming about.
wake-up-early.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a functional cognitive condition like diminished problem-solving skills.

wear-mittens.title: Wear mittens
wear-mittens.directions: Dig out that cozy winter gear and try.

zoom-out.title: Zoom out
zoom-out.directions: Use the text resize controls on your browser to make the text very small.
zoom-out.example: This prompt helps you understand what it’s like to have a visual condition like Nearsightedness.
